titles.title: Child Abuse Court Reform Act of 1988
A bill to amend the Federal Rules of Evidence to provide an explicit hearsay exception in certain child abuse cases.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Criminal Justice.

bill.summary: 1/27/1988--Introduced. Child Abuse Court Reform Act of 1988 - Amends the Federal Rules of Evidence to provide a hearsay exception with respect to statements by children (under the age of 14) regarding their sexual or physical abuse, if: (1) the court finds the statement has circumstantial guarantees of trustworthiness; and (2) there is a substantial likelihood that the child would suffer serious emotional or psychological harm if required to testify.
